conclusion: Introduction to the problem with block A on an inclined plane and cylinder B.
Forces acting on block A at θ = 37° are described.
Variables θ1, θ2, and M are defined.
Analyze equilibrium at θ1 = 37° with static friction at maximum.
Calculate friction force and normal force at θ1 = 37°.
Determine coefficient of static friction μ = 0.75.
Analyze situation at θ2 = 30° with cylinder B present.
Forces on block A at θ2 = 30° are described.
Consider the effect of smooth cylinder B on forces.
Set up equilibrium equations for block A at θ2 = 30°.
Consider system of A and B together with total mass 5m.
Analyze normal force distribution with cylinder B present.
